title: Fed Officials: No Urgency to Pare Monetary Policy Support
sub_head: Chicago Fed’s Evans says it will take some time for price pressures to sustainably hit the central bank’s 2% inflation target
body:
Federal Reserve officials said Wednesday the conditions that would spur them to reduce their monetary policy support for the U.S. economy still lie some way off in the future.
“The outlook has brightened considerably” but “we’ve got some distance to go” before the economy reflects what the central bank wants to see in terms of the labor market and inflation, Fed governor Lael Brainard said during a CNBC interview.
“It...
